actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Subcommittee on Antitrust and Business. Hearings held.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Antitrust, Business Rights and Competition

official_title: A bill to require the application of the antitrust laws to major league baseball, and for other purposes.
short_title: Major League Baseball Antitrust Reform Act of 1995

summary.text: Major League Baseball Antitrust Reform Act of 1995 - Amends the Clayton Act to make the antitrust laws applicable to the business of professional major league baseball, except with respect to baseball's amateur draft, the minor league reserve clause, the Professional Baseball Agreement, or any other matter relating to the minor leagues. Provides that this Act shall not affect the application of the Sports Broadcasting Act of 1961.

titles.title: Major League Baseball Antitrust Reform Act of 1995
A bill to require the application of the antitrust laws to major league baseball, and for other purposes.
